title: Copycat KFC Coleslaw Recipe
description: It's easy to make KFC coleslaw at home with this yummy copycat recipe.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Coleslaw Recipes Copycat KFC Coleslaw 4.1 (15) 15 Reviews 5 Photos For a slaw that looks similar to what you'd find at KFC, we suggest chopping the coleslaw mix before mixing with the dressing. By Sarah Brekke Updated on February 15, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (14 ounce) package coleslaw mix ¼ cup finely chopped yellow onion ½ cup mayonnaise ¼ cup sugar 2 tablespoons milk 2 tablespoons buttermilk 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar ½ teaspoon salt ⅛ teaspoon black pepper Directions Stir together coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, milk, buttermilk, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a second bowl until smooth. Pour dressing over slaw; stir well and chill at least 2 hours or up to overnight. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 167 Calories 12g Fat 14g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 167 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 16% Saturated Fat 2g 10% Cholesterol 10mg 3% Sodium 217mg 9% Total Carbohydrate 14g 5% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Protein 1g 2% Potassium 111mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Copycat KFC Coleslaw 01 of 05 Photo by  AR Magazine 02 of 05 Photo by  Yoly 03/05/2023 This is nowhere near KFC coleslaw! It was just ok but not what I expected. I was actually pretty disappointed. 03 of 05 Photo by  Paula 03/03/2023 This coleslaw did not taste at all like KFC’s, but it was ok. I found it to be too sweet. 04 of 05 Photo by  Lela 02/28/2023 We loved the coleslaw. My family was so hungry that we didn't wait 2 hours to eat the coleslaw. It was still great! I wouldn't change a thing! The slaw doesn't taste quite like KFC; however, the slaw was still great. 05 of 05 Photo by  lutzflcat 02/27/2023 I’ve made a lot of coleslaw, and after mixing up the dressing, I knew it was too runny. I added more mayo, whisked again, and that took care of the dressing consistency. I didn’t use the packaged slaw, just chopped up some cabbage and shredded some carrot. This turned out OK and, honestly, I can’t really say whether or not it tastes like KFC coleslaw, but I know it was too sweet for our taste. Thanks for sharing your recipe. 1 You’ll Also Love Southern Coleslaw 350 Ratings Easy Apple-Carrot Coleslaw 13 Ratings Kohlrabi Slaw 63 Ratings Restaurant-Style Coleslaw II 279 Ratings Copycat Chick-fil-A Slaw 55 Ratings Susan's Vinaigrette Coleslaw 110 Ratings Easy Apple Slaw 774 Ratings Hawaiian Coleslaw 124 Ratings Sweet Sesame Slaw 84 Ratings Sweet Coleslaw 49 Ratings Sweet Restaurant Slaw 3,310 Ratings Vincent's Famous Garlic Coleslaw 20 Ratings Red Cabbage and Celery Root Coleslaw with Apple Cider Dressing 7 Ratings Tommy's Blue Cheese Coleslaw (with Bacon and Grapes) 2 Ratings Creamy German Coleslaw 55 Ratings Creamy Summer Coleslaw 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Sarah Brekke
instructions: Stir together coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl.;Whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, milk, buttermilk, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a second bowl until smooth. Pour dressing over slaw; stir well and chill at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
